treks.title: Upper Mustang Trek (Lo Manthang)
treks.short_description: Classic trek to the walled city of Lo Manthang through Mustang’s rain-shadow landscapes, Tibetan-influenced culture, monasteries, and ancient cave sites. Restricted area trek requiring special permits.
treks.review_text: A culturally rich, arid trans-Himalayan trek to Lo Manthang with dramatic cliffs, caves, and living Tibetan-Buddhist heritage.

hero_section.title: Upper Mustang Trek (Lo Manthang)
hero_section.subtitle: The Forbidden Kingdom Route: Walled City, Monasteries & Desert Valleys

sections.heading: Upper Mustang Trek Overview
articles: Upper Mustang trekking typically follows the Kali Gandaki valley north from Kagbeni into the restricted region toward Lo Manthang. Expect arid landscapes, Tibetan-influenced villages, monasteries, chortens, and cave features shaped by wind erosion.

bullets.text: Restricted area: requires Restricted Area Permit; official fee is USD 500 (first 10 days) + USD 50/day beyond.
Common route points: Kagbeni → Chele → Syangboche → Ghami → Charang → Lo Manthang.
Best seasons: typically spring and autumn for clearer conditions.

itinerary_days.title: Arrive Kathmandu
itinerary_days.description: Arrival and preparation day; permit/briefing commonly arranged via agency for restricted region travel.

itinerary_days.title: Travel to Pokhara
itinerary_days.description: Transit to Pokhara (flight or road), commonly used as staging point for Mustang access.

itinerary_days.title: Fly/Drive to Jomsom; trek to Kagbeni
itinerary_days.description: Reach Jomsom and walk to Kagbeni, a typical gateway settlement before entering the restricted Upper Mustang zone.

itinerary_days.title: Kagbeni to Chele
itinerary_days.description: Enter Upper Mustang region after permit checkpoint and trek north through dry valley terrain to Chele.

itinerary_days.title: Chele to Syangboche
itinerary_days.description: Continue along windswept canyons and cliffs toward Syangboche area (route varies by itinerary).

itinerary_days.title: Syangboche to Ghami
itinerary_days.description: Traverse high desert ridges and valley crossings toward Ghami, known for traditional settlement features.

itinerary_days.title: Ghami to Charang (Tsarang)
itinerary_days.description: Trek to Charang/Tsarang, a major village with monastery culture and traditional architecture.

itinerary_days.title: Charang to Lo Manthang
itinerary_days.description: Approach the walled capital of Upper Mustang, Lo Manthang, a highlight of the restricted region route.

itinerary_days.title: Explore Lo Manthang
itinerary_days.description: Buffer/exploration day commonly used for cultural sites and optional side hikes (specific sites vary by operator).

itinerary_days.title: Return trek (Lo Manthang to Charang area)
itinerary_days.description: Begin return toward the south following a similar corridor (route variations possible).

itinerary_days.title: Charang to Ghami area
itinerary_days.description: Continue return leg through high desert valleys toward Ghami.

itinerary_days.title: Ghami to Kagbeni
itinerary_days.description: Descend south toward Kagbeni, exiting the restricted region zone.

itinerary_days.title: Kagbeni to Jomsom; fly/drive out
itinerary_days.description: Walk back to Jomsom and travel onward (typically to Pokhara).

itinerary_days.title: Return Kathmandu / depart
itinerary_days.description: Return to Kathmandu for departure or buffer day.

highlights.title: Lo Manthang walled city
highlights.description: Reach the historic capital of Upper Mustang, known for its walled settlement and Tibetan-influenced heritage.

highlights.title: Trans-Himalayan desert landscapes
highlights.description: Walk through wind-carved cliffs, canyons, and arid valleys in Nepal’s rain-shadow zone.

highlights.title: Monasteries & chortens
highlights.description: Visit Buddhist sites and traditional villages along the Kali Gandaki corridor.

cost_and_date_section.intro_text: Seasonality, prices, and logistics depend on permits, group size, flights/roads, and lodge availability.

questions.question: Is Upper Mustang restricted?
questions.answer: Yes—Upper Mustang is a restricted trekking area and requires a Restricted Area Permit; official fees are USD 500 for first 10 days and USD 50/day beyond.

additional_info_sections.heading: Important Notes
articles: Upper Mustang requires restricted-area permitting and is typically managed through a registered operator/guide due to local regulations.
Strong winds are common in Mustang; plan trekking hours accordingly.

bullets.text: Carry required permits and passport copies.
